December 17, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We are very much interested in your letter
of December 13 in which you indicate that it would
seem feasible for you to undertake the history of
yellow fever. We do hope to see the end of this dis-
ease. If the result we desire should be accomplished
it will afford a most unusual opportunity to publish
a telling story of one of the great scourges of man-
kind. There is no other man so well prepared to
write this story as you are. We should like to have
you do it.

We shall have to wait upon the action of
our executive committee for final authorization. In
the meantime I see no reason why you should not be
casting about for plans and materials. I shall hope
to see you in Washington in the near future when we
may talk over the details. With these details ad-
Doctor H R Carter
December 17, 1921
2.
justed I shall be prepared to present the matter to
our committee.

With hearty Christmas greetings to you
and Miss Carter and best wishes for a joyous new
year.
